uk.ac.ebi.centres

Interface Ligand<A>

  • Type Parameters:
    A -
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Centre<A>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLigand, NonterminalLigand, PlanarCentre, TerminalLigand, TetrahedralCentre

    public interface Ligand<A>
    Defines a ligand which in the digraph is a side chain of a central atom. The ligand is a node in the Digraph. Each ligand provides the atom that this ligand represents as well as the child ligands. The ligand also allows determination of parent and visited atoms.
    Author:
    John May
    See Also:
    Digraph

        Resets any caches

      • setDescriptor

        void setDescriptor(Descriptor descriptor)
        Sets the descriptor for this centre. This method will throw an illegal argument exception if the descriptor is set to null.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the new descriptor for this centre
        See Also:
        General, Tetrahedral, Planar, Trigonal

      • getDescriptor

        Descriptor getDescriptor()
        Access the descriptor for this centre. This descriptor is the primary descriptor for this centre and not an auxiliary descriptor. Auxiliary descriptors should be set on a per ligand basis. This method should not return null and instead return General.UNKNOWN for unknown/not yet determined centres.
        Returns:
        descriptor for this centre
        See Also:
        General, Tetrahedral, Planar, Trigonal

      • getLigands

        java.util.List<Ligand<A>> getLigands()
        Access the child ligands. Child ligands are ligands that are further away from the central atom in sphere n+1.
        Returns:
        a list of the child ligands

      • getVisited

        java.util.Set<A> getVisited()
        Access all previously visited atoms. For convenience the isVisited(A) method can be used to determine if an atom has already been visited.
        Returns:
        previously visited atoms
        See Also:
        isVisited(Object)

      • isParent

        java.lang.Boolean isParent(A atom)
        Determines if the provided atom is this ligands parent. There is only ever a single parent atom which is closer to the root of the graph. Normally the root ligand will have it's parent set to itself.
        Parameters:
        atom - a potential parent
        Returns:
        whether the atom is the parent (n-1) of this ligand

      • setParent

        void setParent(A atom)
        Set the parent of ligand for when we are shuffling around for auxiliary descriptors. Not supported on planar ligands
        Parameters:
        atom -

        A getParent()
        Returns:

        Returns:
